original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 301/305 to the US dollar, bond and t-bill yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka spot to the US dollar opened at 301.00/305.00 rupees while bonds and bills were steady on Tuesday, dealers said.
The Spot US dollar closed at 300.00/303.00 rupees on Monday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 22.90/23.10 percent unchanged from yesterday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 24.10/40 percent, steady from 24.15/35 percent from Monday.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 was quoted at 25.90/26.10 percent, steady from 25.75/26.00 percent on Monday.
A six-month maturing bill was quoted at 20.00/21.00 percent steady from 20.00/75 percent from Monday close.
